data.title: Church of St. George, Coptic Cairo, Egypt, 2015
data.meta_description: The Coptic quarter of Cairo was built inside the walls of the Roman fortress of Babylon, erected in the 1st Century AD.   The Greek Orthodox Church of St. George dates to the 10th century AD, and possibly earlier.  It was built on top of the northern tower of the fortress and the round shape of the church continues the shape of the Roman tower built in 300 AD.  The current structure was rebuilt following a fire in 1904.  Coptic Cairo is part of the city called Old Cairo.
data.text: The Coptic quarter of Cairo was built inside the walls of the Roman fortress of Babylon, erected in the 1st Century AD. The Greek Orthodox Church of St. George dates to the 10th century AD, and possibly earlier. It was built on top of the northern tower of the fortress and the round shape of the church continues the shape of the Roman tower built in 300 AD. The current structure was rebuilt following a fire in 1904. Coptic Cairo is part of the city called Old Cairo.
